comments.author: The Wind Attack
comments.content: Love it.  I like to do the same thing and it always makes for the best and most leisurely dinners.  I call them cutting board meals.

comments.author: Anne
comments.content:
We do this pretty often at our house - usually a combination of leftovers and new bits, always with crostini. A rosemary-white bean spread is almost always on the menu, along with some kind of cheese, some kind of tomatoes, and usually a crunchy veggie like fennel to dip. Yum.

Michael, I forget - have you ever posted about the book _Artisan Bread in Five Minutes a Day_? I'm floored by how easy they make breadmaking, and I'd love to hear your take on it sometime.

comments.content:
Wind - "cutting board meals" - perfect!
